result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jory Scott Mentz

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court lifts pretrial release monitoring - alcohol monitoring. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with Officer Dadam except in an official capacity.  No contact with S.L.M residence or place of employment.

Court addresses request for bond modification.  Defense requests Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Alcohol Monitoring -Medium be removed.  State has no objection.  Court grants request, removes pretrial release monitoring- alcohol monitoring.  All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.

2:31 PM Defendant Jory Scott Mentz in court.  Attorney Clarence F. Duchac III in court for Jory Scott Mentz.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at.  Atty Duchac requests prelim be scheduled.  JA Wiegand will schedule prelim.  Atty Duchac III requests bond conditions be modified.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jory Scott Mentz in court.  Attorney Hannah Stewart in court for Jory Scott Mentz. Court questions where matter is at. Atty Stewart waives time limits for prelim.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 008160,
Payable Number: 101487,
Receipt Number: 22R 004077,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jory Scott Mentz in court. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Court inquires defendants intention for counsel. Defendant intends to seek counsel. Court gives defendant Court appointed Attorney paperwork. Court explains process of Court Appointed Attorney paperwork to defendant, instructs defendant to return paperwork by 5/31/22 if requesting court appointed attorney. Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No contact direct or indirect with Office Dadam except in an official capacity.  No contact direct or indirect with S.L.M., his residence or place of employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - High Level.

1:19 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jory Scott Mentz appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Defendant indicates he does not qualify for SPD representation.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Court questions defendant on how he wishes to proceed regarding legal counsel.  Defendant indicates he's on a PO hold, if he loses his job, he'll qualify for SPD representation.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
